in spite of a 25cent price hike on the machines the lack of laundry carts remains an issue with only 7 available in the entire laundromat leading to fierce competition during busy hours
the service was satisfactory however the food was somewhat disappointing

phillys represents a quintessential unadorned sports bar that might not dazzle yet it delivers a leisurely setting and an amusing location for social gatherings moreover the amiable staff and the absence of the stereotypical scottsdale characters added to the rejuvenating experience of the place

lamentably the noisy chicken special lacked proper seasoning and the risotto had an unexpected crunchiness it makes me question if the chef tastes their own dishes before serving i wont be returning considering the abundance of better choices in the surrounding area

the prices of the machines have been increased by twentyfive cents yet there still arent sufficient laundry carts available with merely 7 in the entire laundromat it becomes a survival of the fittest when crowded
